definitions.definition: A (small) piece; a fragment; a detached, incomplete portion.
definitions.example: I found a scrap of cloth to patch the hole.
Give the scraps to the dogs and watch them fight.

definitions.definition: The crisp substance that remains after drying out animal fat.
Discarded objects (especially metal) that may be dismantled to recover their constituent materials, junk.
definitions.example: That car isn't good for anything but scrap.

definitions.definition: (in the plural) A piece of deep-fried batter left over from frying fish, sometimes sold with chips.
A Hispanic criminal, especially a Mexican or one affiliated with the Norte gang.
(of a project or plan) To stop working on indefinitely.
To dispose of at a scrapyard.

definitions.example: We got in a little scrap over who should pay the bill.
